CatDescriptText: Mr. Robert L. Lee, steel worker, 908 Second Street, Weirton, W. Va, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think parents should permit teen-agers to smoke, particularly those who still are in school?" answer reads: "I don't think so because it seems to injure the health and affects the growth of young people."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Robert L. Lee wearing dark leather cap and dark varsity jacket and "Bob" embroidered onto left breast, standing on sidewalk, Downtown
